content: The following lists events that happened during **1967 in Singapore**. - [National Service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore) was first introduced in Singapore by Defence Minister, [Goh Keng Swee](/wiki/Goh_Keng_Swee) ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 27 January – The [Chartered Industries of Singapore](/wiki/ST_Kinetics) is established to produce ammunition for the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces). ### February - 15 February – The [Civilian War Memorial](/wiki/Civilian_War_Memorial) is unveiled at the [War Memorial Park](/wiki/War_Memorial_Park,_Singapore). - 24 February – [1967 by-elections](/wiki/1967_Singaporean_by-elections): Nomination day is held for the by-elections. After nominations closed, [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP) candidates Teo Hup Teck (Jalan Kayu), Chew Chin Han (Tampines), [Pathmanaban Selvadurai](/wiki/P._Selvadurai) (Bukit Panjang) and Lim Soo Peng (Havelock) win their seats via a [walkover](/wiki/Walkover). However, there is a contest for the Thomson seat, where PAP's Ang Nam Piau campaigned against two independent candidates, M. P. D. Nair and Chan Yoke Kwong. ### March - 7 March – The [1967 by-election](/wiki/1967_Singaporean_by-elections) is held in the Thomson constituency only. After polling closed, PAP's Ang Nam Piau won by a huge majority of 9,407 votes against M. P. D. Nair and Chan Yoke Kwong, who had garnered 1,310 and 537 votes respectively. The by-election resulted in the PAP having all the seats in [Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) until the [1981 Anson by-election](/wiki/1981_Anson_by-election), where [J. B. Jeyaretnam](/wiki/J._B._Jeyaretnam) from the [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) wins the by-election. - 14 March – The [National Service](/wiki/National_Service) bill is passed by the [parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). - 18 March – [Shin Min Daily News](/wiki/Shin_Min_Daily_News) is launched. - 28 March – Registrations for [National Service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore) begin at the Central Manpower Base. - 30 March – The [SEACOM](/wiki/SEACOM_(Asian_cable_system)) cable is launched. The cable went in operation until its decommissioning in 1986. ### April - 7 April – The [Board of Commissioners of Currency, Singapore](/wiki/Board_of_Commissioners_of_Currency,_Singapore) (present day [Monetary Authority of Singapore](/wiki/Monetary_Authority_of_Singapore)) is established with the power to issue Singapore currency. ### May - 5 May – The [Republic of Singapore Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy) is formed. - 11 May – The Garden City vision was introduced to make Singapore a clean and green city, with the planting of trees. ### June - 12 June – The first currency notes, known as the [Orchid series](/wiki/Singapore_Dollar#Orchid_series) were issued, as well as the [Marine Series](/wiki/Singapore_Dollar#Coins). ### July - July – The first batch of the army is drafted for [National Service](/wiki/National_service_in_Singapore). ### August - 8 August – Singapore is one of the founding members of the [Association of Southeast Asian Nations](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations) (ASEAN). ### October - 30 October - The Science Council of Singapore is formed to develop Singapore's capabilities in science and technology. ## Births - 1 July – [Kym Ng](/wiki/Kym_Ng), actress. - 31 March – [Ang Wei Neng](/wiki/Ang_Wei_Neng), politician and business leader. - 13 April – [Jimmy Nah](/wiki/Jimmy_Nah), actor and comedian. (d. (/wiki/2008)) - 12 June – [Penny Low](/wiki/Penny_Low), former PAP MP for [Pasir Ris–Punggol GRC](/wiki/Pasir_Ris%E2%80%93Punggol_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 6 October – [Terence Cao](/wiki/Terence_Cao), actor. - 30 October – [Murali Pillai](/wiki/Murali_Pillai), PAP MP for [Bukit Batok SMC](/wiki/Bukit_Batok_Single_Member_Constituency) and [Jurong East–Bukit Batok GRC](/wiki/Jurong_East%E2%80%93Bukit_Batok_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 31 October – [Mardan Mamat](/wiki/Mardan_Mamat), golf player. - 21 November – [Benedict Tan](/wiki/Benedict_Tan), former national sailor. - Claire Tham, author. - [Joan Pereira](/wiki/Joan_Pereira), PAP MP for [Tanjong Pagar GRC](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_Group_Representation_Constituency). - [Desmond Lim](/wiki/Desmond_Lim), 2nd Chairman of the [Singapore Democratic Alliance](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Alliance). ## Deaths - 5 January – [Xing Ying](/wiki/Xing_Ying), writer and editor of literary supplements (b. 1911). - 19 May – Chew Hock Leong, former Chairman of the [Public Service Commission](/wiki/Public_Service_Commission_(Singapore)) and former General Manager of [OCBC](/wiki/OCBC_Bank) (b. 1897). - 2 June – [Lee Kong Chian](/wiki/Lee_Kong_Chian), businessman, philanthropist and Chinese community leader (b. 1893). - 14 June – Yeo Chan Boon, [Teochew](/wiki/Teochew_people) community leader (b. 1881). - 6 November – [Ng Keng Siang](/wiki/Ng_Keng_Siang), architect (b. 1908). title: 1967 in Singapore
